documents.document: @TalkingCityFC @abcgrandstand @abcnews hi there, sure. Can you email details to carter.brittany@abc.net.au

@_stellb @abcgrandstand @abcnews thanks Stella ðŸ˜Š
@Dragonet_WA @abcgrandstand just a matter of when we have staff on and when it was submitted.
@Lee_Gaskin1 @bencubby @abcgrandstand @abcnews TY Lee. Coming from yourself, as someone who covered it so closely, appreciate your thoughts
@Dragonet_WA @abcgrandstand entitled to your opinion. But at time of publish I was enjoying putting AFLW to air. So no fact behind it
@Dragonet_WA @abcgrandstand no... just about when we had time to publish the story. But sure, draw whatever conclusions you wish.
Amazing how many people are quick to dish out opinions on an article they haven't actually read! Read first, then form your opinions ðŸ™„
@IanSyson @WestSydney @dkfcdotnet @abcgrandstand @abcnews how can you be commenting on something you haven't read!?
@IanSyson @WestSydney @dkfcdotnet @abcgrandstand @abcnews article is trying to work out why WL receives less media attn. Have you read it?
@dkfcdotnet @IanSyson @WestSydney @abcgrandstand @abcnews WBBL ran alongside BBL. You can give media coverage & market both genders at once
@IanSyson @WestSydney @dkfcdotnet @abcgrandstand @abcnews doesn't mean there won't be a write up on the men's soccer results in the papers
@IanSyson @WestSydney @dkfcdotnet @abcgrandstand @abcnews not completely true... I've seen bigger crowds at A-League games than NRL.
@jemo8009 @abcgrandstand @WLeague it's got something to do with their deal with Fox Sports (as far as I understand).
Our @LadiesWhoLeague pod starts season 2 nxt wk! Get your fix early ðŸŽ§ last yr's highlights here: https://t.co/oXQfHkW7DI #ladieswholeague
@Dragonet_WA @abcgrandstand ummm that article was written today and published by our online team tonight... don't understand your point?
@CaptainAngelo @AnnOdong thanks Angela!
@sarahgillmanTAS @abcgrandstand @WLeague not trying to create a wedge, trying to bring attention that WLeague deserves just as much coverage
@erinrileyau @benraue people aren't going to turn up or tune in because they suddenly know a player is getting paid more. Separate issues.
@erinrileyau @benraue how much you pay players doesn't relate to the organisation surrounding a comp & priority in equal marketing?
@benraue @erinrileyau how can there be such a huge amount of women playing but it not be popular...? That's the point
@benraue @erinrileyau well point of the article is to point out enough isn't being done to let huge grassroots participation know about comp
@melissacbrooks @erinrileyau yes, that's a feeling shared among many people Melissa. Issue goes much further than pay
@benraue @erinrileyau did you read the article? Soccer has one of the highest participation rates for women in this country.
@erinrileyau plenty of players in cricket & AFL still not earning full time wages. Agree it's an issue, but not what I'm talking about here
@erinrileyau more to it then that Erin...
@amychow_ cheers Amy. Thanks for sharing ðŸ˜Š
@gwynne007 @abcgrandstand @abcnews don't agree re netball Adam. It's had the strongest participation for such a long time. It'll be fine.
@TimBrunero @NewsRadio too kind Tim! One under our belt, can only get better from here :D
@martynlawrence2 @abcgrandstand @abcnews that's a big factor Martyn! More in the article...

@simonjourno but... hard to say Sixers won't destroy them, the way they have the other teams... today was all class.
@simonjourno hmmm. I think home turf will be a big factor. They've just played at home while Sixers have flown to Brisbane and now head west
